name: The Bias Binding Guide - a digital handbook
description:
Creating and applying bias tape/binding are sewing techniques that once you learn how to do correctly, you will never look back. You'll wonder why you had been putting them off all these years!

I've put together this handy guide of all related content from The Haby Goddess blog, Sew School plus new original material.  

It's a collection of step by step instructions with clear detailed images plus a few extra bonus video's thrown in also.

Here's what the guide contains:

Finding your grain
Difference between single & double bias
Handy Tools
How much fabric will I need?
What types of fabric to use?
Cutting your fabric strips
Making your bias
Joining your bias strips
Using a bias tape maker
Sewing on your bias binding – Technique 1 (includes video)
Sewing on your bias binding – Technique 2
Add bias to curves
How to achieve a neat corner?
Finishing off bias binding (video)
Additional techniques – Add bias to an inside edge
Bias binding gadgets – Using a binding foot attachment
Bias binding gadgets – Simplicity Bias Tape Maker

File size is 2.3mb and it will be automatically sent to your paypal address after purchase.

Written & photographed by Jodie Maloni of The Haby Goddess and Sew School Online.

name: Basic Haby Packs for Sew School
description:
There are not a lot of materials need to complete the Sew School online course.

To make it easier for you, I have put together a packs of items that you will use throughout the lessons.

You will need additional materials for the projects sheets.

Included in this pack:

White shirring elastic
White knitted elastic
18cm white invisible zip
18cm white traditional dress zip
3 x 2m x 20mm wide bias (colours may vary to what is pictured)
18mm bias maker
Packet of light weight iron on interfacing
I will also include a bonus piece of pellon which will be used during the applique lesson.
